Component changed

It would be good if there was a Trac component for Trac as well, so bugs like this one could go in it.

item.title: Ticket #1403 (There should be a Trac component for Website) created
item.dc:creator: simonw
item.description: Bug #1402 concerns the WordPress website; it would be good if Trac had Website as a component, as at the moment bugs concerning the site end up in General.

item.title: Ticket #1402 (wordpress.org/extend/themes should link to the Codex) created
item.dc:creator: simonw
item.description:
​http://wordpress.org/extend/themes/ currently just says "Very very soon. We promise.". Since it's linked to from the Themes page of the WordPress admin, it would be better if it said something along the lines of:

"Coming very soon. We promise. In the meantime, check out the list of themes on the Codex"

And linked to:

​http://codex.wordpress.org/Using_Themes/Theme_List

item.title: Ticket #1401 (wp-admin/post.php doesn't use wp_insert_post()) created
item.dc:creator: mgeisler
item.description: I think the code in wp-admin/post.php should use the wp_insert_post() function from wp-includes/functions-post.php so as to avoid duplicating the code.

item.title: Ticket #1181 (comment posting leads to blank page) updated
item.dc:creator: SystemOfAJon
item.description:
(I am the anonymousbugger that posted on 18 06:39:08 2005)

After 1.5.1.1 I hoped that this may have been fixed...but no. I upgraded my test blog to see if it would work, but it obviously didn't.

I have disabled all of the plugins and reverted back to the Default theme. The one variable here would be that I've turned the "privacy control" on Norton Internet Security off when testing it, or having it on.

For some reason or another, I have to turn it off to activate plugins or such (i.e., having referrers enabled). Now I have to do this when commenting too?

item.title: Ticket #154 (Can't future date a draft) closed
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
fixed:

When I change the date of drafts and then save them it seems to save it, even though if you forget to uncheck the box it'll update the date.

item.title: Ticket #1400 (WordPress should use the latest version of IXR) created
item.dc:creator: simonw
item.description:
I'm testing a new release of IXR, which includes some important bug fixes and merges in most of the changes made to the WordPress fork. The changes I've skipped are the optional vendor arguments to IXR_Client (which isn't used by the WordPress source anyway) and the ​timezone support - everything else is in there.

It would be great if WordPress could use this version; if not, you'll need to merge in the bug fixes. I've tested the new version myself but I'd strongly recommend testing it further before rolling it in to a full WordPress release.

The new version is available here: ​http://scripts.incutio.com/xmlrpc/tests/IXR_Library.inc.php.txt

item.title: Ticket #1399 (htaccess mod_rewrite rules could be cleaner) created
item.dc:creator: turnip
item.description:
Following a discussion on wp-hackers (​http://comox.textdrive.com/pipermail/wp-hackers/2005-May/001083.html) it seems that the .htaccess mod_rewrite rules for pages could be cleaned up significantly by using a (page1|page2|page3|etc) syntax instead of having a new set of rules for each and every page. Example: 

RewriteRule ^(page1|page2|page3)/trackback/?$ /index.php?pagename=$1&tb=1 [QSA,L]
RewriteRule ^(page1|page2|page3)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /index.php?pagename=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L]
RewriteRule ^(page1|page2|page3)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /index.php?pagename=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L]
RewriteRule ^(page1|page2|page3)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /index.php?pagename=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L]
RewriteRule ^(page1|page2|page3)/?([0-9]+)?/?$ /index.php?pagename=$1&page=$2 [QSA,L]

item.title: Ticket #1341 (<!--nextpage--> navigation on permalinks with no trailing slash fails) reopened
item.dc:creator: Joen
item.description:
Kudos on fixing it, but there's still a problem.

When using ​wp_link_pages in the following way:

<?php wp_link_pages('before=<p>&after=</p>&next_or_number=number&pagelink=%'); ?>

the problem re-appears. The "Next" link will link to /%postname%2/ rather than /%postname%/2/
